subdivision_of_building: Area of existing gravel hardstanding to southeast of Chiswick House - please see accompanying plans for details.
description: Installation of a temporary marquee for a period of eight months per calendar year, until 31st December 2034
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The permission hereby granted shall be for a limited period of ten years to 31st December 2034 for erecting a marquee no longer than eight months per calendar year. 
When the use shall cease, the marquee shall be removed within one week of 31st December 2034. The site shall be made good no later than one month after its removal for each yearly period.
Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [720-P-01-A, 720-P-02-A, 720-P-03-A, 720-P-04-A, Planning, Heritage, Design and Environment Statement, Fire Safety Plans and Reasonable Exception Statement. Received: 18/03/2024
Baseline Noise Survey. Received: 03/07/2024 
Event Management Plan. Received: 09/12/2024].
Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.
Condition : 3 - The use hereby permitted for marquee event purposes shall not be carried out outside of 08.00 � 00.00 (midnight).
Reason. To protect neighbouring amenity.
Condition : 4 - All events shall be carried out in accordance with the events management measures in the Event Management Plan.
Reason: To safeguard the amenity of surrounding residents.
Condition : 5 - The music noise level (MNL) measured or predicted at 1m from the Great Chertsey Road / Burlington Lane entrance gates of the park shall not exceed 65dB(a) over a 15-minute period. Regular checks shall be carried out within the marquee and at the Burlington Lane gate to monitor the noise using a Class 2 (or better) Sound Level Meter and to ensure that the MNL is not exceeded. Noise measurements will begin no more than 10 minutes after the start of an event and continue every 45 minutes thereafter for events held between the hours of 19:00 and 23:00.
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living conditions.
Condition : 6 - Noise monitoring should be undertaken for all events with amplified music. Where complaints are raised to the license holder, or stipulated levels are exceeded, details of the complaint or exceedance on the MNL shall be notified to the Council within 14 calendar days from the event. In the event of a complaint being made to the Council, a report shall be produced by the license holder that includes details of any complaints or exceedances of the MNL, and action(s) taken to resolve the matter that relates to the event in question. The report shall only be produced following a formal request by the Council and will be provided within 14 calendar days of the request.
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living conditions.
Condition : 7 - No Fireworks displays shall take place in conjunction with any event held in or adjoining the Marquee hereby approved.
Reason: To protect neighbouring amenity.
Condition : 8 - Accessibility to the marquee for wheelchair users, including provisions for disabled parking spaces, shall be provided in accordance with the specifications noted in the design and access statement and shall be maintained whilst the marquee is in use.
Reason: To ensure inclusive access
Condition : 9 - No additional structures associated with the marquee use shall be erected on site other than those approved within.
Reason: To protect heritage assets
